item.title: Mount Ordeals

item.title: P6S - Hegemone
item.description: Encounter Info DPS Check 53.9k Enrage 10:39 Drops Chest One Chest Two 1 coffer randomly selected from the following 2 unique coffers randomly selected from the following - Head - Head - Hand - Hand - Foot - Foot Tome weapon trade-in Tome accesory upgrade Strategy Reference Aetheric Polyominoid Cheat Sheet (Click for full-size)

item.title: P7S - Adgistis
item.description: Encounter Info DPS Check 58.6k Enrage 11:13 Drops Chest One Chest Two 1 coffer randomly selected from the following 1 Leg coffer - Head Tome armor upgrade - Hand Tome weapon upgrade - Foot Strategy Reference Position Setup Blades of Attis Forbidden Fruit 1 Bough of Attis For this, the red debuff indicates a point-blank AoE that needs to be spread, and the blue debuff indicates a stack marker.

item.title: P8S - Hephaistos
item.description: Encounter Info DPS Check Part I: 59.8k Part II: 64.8k Enrage Part I: 7:52 Part II: 8:26 Drops Chest One Chest Two 1 coffer randomly selected from the following 2 unique coffers randomly selected from the following Strategy Reference PART I Illusory Creation/Manifold Flames OR Two possible patterns for this, priority is based on your corner partners (so, if your corner is NW, you would go either north or west).

item.title: P9S - Kokytos
item.description: Encounter Info DPS Check Enrage 9:59 Strategy Reference Kokytos opens with 2 raidwides - Gluttony’s Augur, which simply deals moderate raidwide damage, followed shortly by Ravening, which signals a phase transition, and deals moderate raidwide damage after a 5 second delay.

item.title: Sage
item.description: Openers In both of the below openers, any Dosis III can be replaced with Toxicon II. If there’s an opening raidwide (which, there pretty much always is), I tend to shield pre-pull and then use Toxicon II directly before the first Phlegma III because I like the sound it makes when you get an Addersting stack.

item.title: Summoner
item.description: Openers Garuda Opener Gain when group is heavy in 15s buffs and you can clip Slipstream under the buff window. Otherwise, use Titan opener below.
